metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000544 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: rubyzip gem rubyzip version 1.2.1 and earlier contains a Directory Traversal vulnerability in Zip::File component that can result in write arbitrary files to the filesystem. This attack appear to be exploitable via If a site allows uploading of .zip files , an attacker can upload a malicious file that contains symlinks or files with absolute pathnames "../" to write arbitrary files to the filesystem..

criterions.comment: ruby-zip package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-1.1').
